climbs.name: Toad in the Hole
climbs.fa: Blake Bowling, Rachel Jones, Ian Kir

content.description: Like most routes on this wall, easier climbing culiminates in a crux at the top.  You may find yourself picking the wrong direction at the lip, good luck!
content.location: Starts on the wall just right of the large hueco.

content.description: Nice flow of jugs leads to some crimping to the anchors. Many a suitor has been denied their send by shedding of grips. Save some for clipping the anchors.
content.location: Start about 5 feet left of of a large hueco on the right.   There is one more route to the right before the hueco.

climbs.name: Hoolie Hoggin' in a Booger Hole

content.description: Probaby the best warmup on the wall. Finger friendly jugs and a moderate pump.
content.location: Starts about 10 feet right of the arete at the left end of the wall.

content.description: Jugs but pumpy. Don't let your ego get in the way and get flashed pumped.
content.location: This routes starts about 5 feet right of the arete

content.description:
This is one is on the shorter side, but it doesn't give you much to rest on.  Move quick to avoid blowing it going to the chains.

Take note it is possible to hit the large tree behind you if you blow going to the chains. Take care not to jump off the rock when you fall to avoid scraping against the tree as you fall.
content.location: Far right side of the wall

climbs.name: Hole Milk (aka Missed the Hole)
climbs.fa: Ian Kirk, Peter Jones, Blake Bowling

content.description: Start on the face around the left side of the arete. Boulder through some difficult pockets and work your way up to a no hands stance on the ledge. Cut right to the other face and continue a couple more bolts of pumpy but easier climbing.
content.location: This is the first route you will encounter as you walk up the trail to the wall.

content.description: Skirt the left side of the large hueco and then trend right up through some jugs that aren't quite as good as you expect. Anchors were lowered a bit to provide a more consistent climb with a satisfying jug to clip the anchors from.
content.location: This the last route on the left before a large hueco mid way up the wall

content.description: This one is harder than it looks and is more sustained through out with few jugs to shake on. Choose you path to the anchors wisely or you may find yourself crossed up.
content.location: This route starts to the right of the hueco about 8 feet

content.description: Starts on the right side of the hueco. Clip the perma from large horn on left side of the hueco. Nice flow of jugs leads to a pair of runnels and a blind move over the lip. Once you stick that, Get in the Hole!
content.location: Starts on the right side of the hueco. Clip the perma from large horn on left side of the hueco.
